name: afastidioushat
text: Todd is an excellent Carla.

name: fallow_fields
text: lol, beef's laugh is the best. Even at his most amused, a simple 'hee hee' is all that comes out

name: saint
text: his eyes look like one Pacman chasing another. Cute.

name: brokeaccount
text: The one on the left is burping.

name: catachresis
text: Mr. Bear is Frasier.

name: mira
text: Totally. His is the only voice I can imagine, because I am imagining it as Frasier's.

name: riazm
text: A comment left by riazm was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by CatJumpJohn, brynito, Tony)

name: catachresis
text: I have slightly revised my opinion, in that I can't decide between Kelsey Grammer and Stephen Fry for Cornelius' voice. So difficult.

name: zeroasalimit
text: Kelsey Grammer. If he dies, then Fry. Also, although Frasier is the classiest fictional character on television, Mr. Bear has him outclassed.

name: spinynorman
text:
Stephen Fry is considerably more English than Kelsey Grammer, whose characters are pretty pompous but whose actual life is like a coked-up trainwreck, and the train was filled with Playboy Bunnies.

As Stephen Fry played Jeeves himself from Wodehouse, and Cornelius seems to be largely inspired by Wodehouse, the match is already made. I mean, Fry himself said his fucking vocal chords are practically made of tweed.

name: zeroasalimit
text: Damn man, way to lay the logic down. I like Wodehouse aswell. I must capitulate to your point of view.

name: spiderbaby
text: A comment left by spiderbaby was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, straw, FVVS, BilliousBill, daidai, treasureplane, GMM, farqussus, Talbain, cailetshadow)

name: danbicker
text: I am late but I feel it must be said: David McCallum. He is the true voice of Cornelius Bear.

name: lolsworth
text: Stephen Fry is not a Republican so he wins the tiebreak.

name: squi
text: Ugh, no. The Frasier character is way too full of himself, and I would hate to see any of that bleed into Mr. Bear through Kelsey Grammer's voice. James Earl Jones all the way.

name: ford
text: It is weird that you would go from Kelsey Grammer to James Earl Jones.  I can't even imagine James Earl (awesome though he may be) speaking in a British accent.  But wouldn't it be great, if in this fictional animated series James Earl Jones came on as a bunch of small-part characters?  Imagine the voice of, say, Robert Johnson, or the guy on the phone that buys Ray's soul for a piano.

name: theguitarhero
text:
[quote=ford]the guy on the phone that buys Ray's soul for a piano.[/quote]

You mean, THE DEVIL?

name: mystkmanat
text: RACIST.

name: son_of_selleck
text: A comment left by son_of_selleck was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, cmjhogan, crawfomp, Johnnyrocker, spaghettisdad, DrSkradley, mighty_pit, cailetshadow, mattylite, motts)

name: ford
text: Complaining about some lames is the best way to add to the pile.

name: lawdog
text: Kelsey to this day studies old Achewoods in the hopes of being half as classy as Cornelius. I think David Bowie should get the honors.

name: catachresis
text:
I think David Bowie would do a good job as RLS AKA TMWTBOHH*. Imagine this strip, with David Bowie's voice, all totally not being able to do the southern accent, but the amazing synth music in the background makes it amazing. Possibly.

*Is this an officially sanctioned acronym?

name: alphagator
text: man before I realized that was supposed to be an acronym I thought it was Lovecraftian

name: spinynorman
text: I thought he was mocking the debate by filling in gibberish in place of a reference. It was pretty hilarious when I read it, and then when I finished it it got even funnier.

name: hassanoleary
text: I bet Willem Dafoe would make a good Ramses/Rodney.

name: zeal
text: No.  The only man who can do justice to Ramses Luther is Powers Boothe.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
"Little girl, I'm going to fill your mouth with spiders."

GOD yes.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Neither of you have seen Boondock Saints, have you?

name: tekende
text: Michael Caine maybe. Not Bowie. Much as I love Bowie, his speaking voice is a little too effete for Ramses.

name: farqussus
text:
I can't imagine Cornelius from London.

"Ere. Just a momentary diversion. on the road. to the grave, my young china."

No I think not.

name: tekende
text: Naw, I'm thinking, like, Secondhand Lions Michael Caine. Trying admirably but ultimately failing at a Southern US accent, you know?

name: tekende
text: For Ramses, not Cornelius, fyi.

name: jhunt
text: Those Pac-Man eyes squick me out something fierce.

name: saurkraus
text: I think that's a reference to the really old-school Mickey Mouse drawings.

name: closefriend
text: I was going to talk about how Beef in this strip should be called "Steamboat Beefy," but that opens up a whole new can of worms.

name: relaxing
text: Compare/contrast the "Stoned Lightning" eyes?

name: nbgreene
text: A comment left by nbgreene was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, solobuttons, equinn2006)

name: centipede_damascus
text: Almost the best Achewood ever.

name: rotating-dog
text: Well it comes damn close. An obvious favourite, you might notice.

name: wolfslice
text: haha, this one's gotta be in my top 3

name: untilyouaresonude
text: The Woody hair is amazing. Harrelson should be notified, if he doesn't read already.

name: ghostd
text: Oh, hee hee hee!

name: delzhand
text: I think this last panel should replace the current graphic for rating a comic a 5.

name: zem
text:
yeah actually

and replace 4 with the current 5

name: stuart
text: ideally you would get like 20 of these

name: thegrapist
text: oh my goodness!

name: sherwood
text:
Now i finally know what to use that set of Mii eyes for.

Oh, hee hee.

name: thicker
text: Beef's eyes in the last panel are henceforth to be known as "Davide" eyes (see 04/23/2007). Or vice-versa, you know, whatever.

name: slanger
text: Yeah!  Glazed with glee.

name: hexjumper
text:
This is the other moment that takes Roast Beef from being one-note to being a more rounded character - his friends pull him out of an awesome depression and into being a part of the group. It's also the first time that we see Ray using his money - or, in this case, connections - to cheer up Roast Beef.

Also, Phillipe makes an awesome Woody.

name: zeroasalimit
text: A comment left by zeroasalimit was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apricotta, gethen, rachel, cailetshadow, dj_insomniac, tropicana, peterjoel)

name: woodenteeth
text: dude. really. oh man. that totally reads like a wrong-end-of-a-three-coffee-day post.

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: I don't think Beef has ever been so happy.

name: phthoggos
text: 5'd for the last panel alone.

name: deancain29
text: Todd owns this version of Carla - he freakin owns it.

name: epicurus
text:
Oh, hee hee hee!
Oh, Hee hee!

name: qatipay
text: is this both the nicest Todd's ever been and the happiest Beef's ever been??

name: peterjoel
text: if Todd was a woman, he would actually be Carla

name: tinhand
text: That last panel is actually LMAO funny. He seems to go completely hysterical. Definitely 5/5.

name: atticusonline
text: wakka wakka wakka

name: prolefeed5
text: The fact that Cornelius, Todd and Phillipe are assigned so perfectly to Cheers characters is almost kind of creepy... (not so sure about Teodore, but he's a complicated character).

name: tripleg
text: ideally, ray would be sam, but then ray couldn't give the tour

name: trollcollins
text: The final panel is a horrifying rictus when viewed in isolation (i.e. out of context).

name: mattylite
text: You mean a horrifying rictus that I... ...Boned?

name: trollcollins
text: I mean yeah sure if you are into eyeballs that have cleaved from the intense pressure of joy being felt. Go to town with that.

name: mattylite
text: You mean the town that I... ...Boned?

name: prolefeed5
text: I see what you did there...

name: milkpants
text: i never liked cheers 'til i liked this strip

name: gopacapulco
text: This is the funniest strip i've read so far

name: gethen
text: Is this the first time we see Cornelius out of his robe and in one of his delightful suits?

name: johnnyc
text: I got a "The Dude Is From Circumstances" tee this Christmas and reacted exactly like Beef in the last panel.

name: filossoapeyed
text: In the almost seven years this strip has been running, you will never see a happier Beef than a Beef with Cheers on the brain. So what if he's experienced heaven? So what if he's marrying his dream girl? Cheers is his true love.

name: eiv
text: my vote was #666

name: pzukowski
text: Beef's grinning glee gives me hope.

name: octafish
text: Pffft, Cheers is not Cheers without Norm and Cliffy, oh Ratzenburger, the intricate falsehoods you weaved remind me of simpler times.

name: intelligentblue
text: the happiest you will ever see Roast Beef

name: mercuri0us
text:
Beef looks like he's going to explode with joy.

Oh, hee hee hee!
Hee hee!
Oh, hee hee hee!
Hee hee hee hee hee hee heeeeeeeeeBOOOOOMMM.

name: br633
text: I love it just for that look on Roast Beef's face at the end.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Beef's eyes in the last pane showing the love he never thought he'd get- priceless.

name: applebed
text: Beef's eyes frighten me here.

name: rhymebomb
text: This is the best Achewood.

name: wallabeechamp
text: See? Ray truly cares for Roast Beef, he just never knows how to show it!

name: carlyle
text: Five for last panel.

name: fakedaisies
text: Yes. Between that and "Carla" asking to be hit with a folding chair in lieu of an abortion, this is probably my favorite strip.
